sentences.en: ‘Has he got a girlfriend?’ Jill asked, trying to sound nonchalant.
sentences.cn: “他有女朋友吗？”吉尔装出无所谓的样子问道。

sentences.en: " Really, " I said, trying to sound nonchalant. " I'm sure a reason. "
sentences.cn: “ 真的, ” 我说, 努力听起来漠不关心. “ 肯定有原因的. ”

sentences.en: Being a little nonchalant will probably attract more attention.
sentences.cn: 一点点的不在意更有可能引起更多的关注.

sentences.en: Clark's mother is nonchalant about her role in her son's latest work.
sentences.cn: 克拉克的母亲对自己在儿子最新作品中的角色漠不关心。

sentences.en: Denis tried to look nonchalant and uninterested.
sentences.cn: 丹尼斯竭力表现出漠不关心、不感兴趣的样子。

sentences.en: He appeared nonchalant in court even when the judge ordered him to pay ￡1000.
sentences.cn: 在法庭上,甚至当法官命令他赔偿一千镑时,他仍然表现得若无其事.

sentences.en: He immediately remarked with the most nonchalant air.
sentences.cn: 他接着就装出十分冷静的模样说了话.

sentences.en: His nonchalant attitude nonchalance irritated me.
sentences.cn: 他那漠不关心的态度使我恼火.

sentences.en: HuHuman often at nonchalant time only will then understand.
sentences.cn: 人往往在不经意的时候才会懂得.

sentences.en: It merely underlines our rather more nonchalant attitude to life.
sentences.cn: 这仅仅是更凸显了我们相当漠然的生活态度。

sentences.en: One should not take an indifferent ( or nonchalant ) attitude towards questions of principle.
sentences.cn: 对原则问题不应采取无可无不可的态度.

sentences.en: She defeat all her rival for the job with nonchalant ease.
sentences.cn: 她从容不迫地击败求职的所有竞争者.

sentences.en: She was so nonchalant, so defiant.
sentences.cn: 她是这么无所谓, 这么大胆无畏.

sentences.en: She's giving boys what they want, tries to act nonchalant.
sentences.cn: 她试著冷静表现出男孩们想要的.

sentences.en: The year is nonchalant in you time, likes the air, cannot pay attention every day.
sentences.cn: 岁月在你不经意的时候, 就像空气, 不会每天都去关注.

sentences.en: We are those two natural and nonchalant persons.
sentences.cn: 大家都这样很自然也平淡.

sentences.en: With a nonchalant stroll and a whistle, the US president walked past another set of locked French doors before he was finally able to gain access to his seat of power.
sentences.cn: 总统先生淡定地踱一圈步、吹了声口哨，经过一排同样被锁起来的法式落地窗门，最终进入办公室、回到自己的“宝座”。

trans.tran_cn: 漠不关心的，冷淡的，漫不经心的，不感兴趣的，恬然
trans.tran_en: If you describe someone as nonchalant, you mean that they appear not to worry or care about things and that they seem very calm
